info.title: xRegistry API
info.description: xRegistry API. See spec sections (e.g. 'Registry Capabilities', 'Retrieving the Registry Model', 'Doc', etc.) for details.

get.description: Gets the root registry document. Query parameters 'inline', 'filter', 'doc', and 'specversion' modify the view. (See spec: Retrieving the Registry, Inline, Filter, and Doc)

put.description: Uploads a registry document and upserts its contents into the registry. (See spec: Creating or Updating Entities, Registry Entity)

requestBody.description: A registry document in JSON format.

200.description: The resulting registry document after upsert.

patch.description: Edits a registry document. (See spec: Creating or Updating Entities, Registry Entity)

requestBody.description: A registry document in JSON format.

200.description: The resulting registry document after upsert.

get.description: Retrieves the registry capabilities. Query parameter 'offered' may be used to return the offered values. (See spec: Registry Capabilities)

parameters.name: offered
parameters.description: If true, returns the offered values (enumeration, min, max, etc.) for each capability.

put.description: Updates the registry capabilities. (See spec: Registry Capabilities, Updating the Capabilities of a Server)

requestBody.description: The full capabilities map to update.

patch.description: Patches one or more capabilities. (See spec: Updating the Capabilities of a Server)

get.description: Retrieves the full registry model. Query parameter 'schema' may be used to request a specific model schema format. (See spec: Retrieving the Registry Model)

parameters.name: schema
parameters.description: The model schema format (e.g. xRegistry-json/1.0-RC1).

put.description: Updates the registry model. (See spec: Updating the Registry Model)

patch.description: Patches the registry model. (PATCH is only supported on the /model endpoint.) (See spec: Updating the Registry Model)

get.description: Exports the entire registry as a single document (alias for GET /?doc&inline=*,model,capabilities). (See spec: Exporting)
Gets a single resource group. (See spec: Groups)

put.description: Creates or updates a resource group. Supports query parameters for epoch checking and response configuration. (See spec: Creating or Updating Entities and Deleting Entities in a Registry Collection)

parameters.name: epoch
parameters.description: The current epoch of the group for optimistic concurrency (see spec: Mismatched Epoch).

requestBody.description: The group to create or update.

delete.description: Deletes a resource group. Requires the current epoch. (See spec: Deleting Entities in a Registry Collection)

parameters.name: epoch
parameters.description: The current epoch of the group.

get.description: Gets an optionally filtered collection of resources in a group. Supports query parameters 'inline', 'skip', 'top', 'filter', and 'doc'. (See spec: Registry Collections, Inline, Filter, and Resource Metadata vs Resource Document)

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of resources to skip (pagination).

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: The number of resources to return (pagination).

parameters.name: epoch
parameters.description: The current epoch of the resource metadata (meta sub-object). (See spec: Resource Attributes)

get.description: Gets the meta sub-object of a resource. (See spec: Resource Attributes)

put.description: Updates the meta sub-object of a resource. (See spec: Resource Attributes and Updating the Registry Entity)

requestBody.description: The new meta object for the resource.

patch.description: Patches the meta sub-object of a resource. (See spec: Resource Attributes)

get.description: Gets the resource metadata view (the $details view). (See spec: Retrieving a Resource as Metadata and Doc)

parameters.name: meta
parameters.description: If true, operate on the resource metadata sub-object (see spec: Resource Metadata vs Resource Document).

parameters.name: noepoch
parameters.description: If true, epoch validation is ignored. (See spec: Creating or Updating Entities)

parameters.name: nodefaultversionid
parameters.description: If true, any provided defaultversionid is ignored. (See spec: Default Version of a Resource)

parameters.name: nodefaultversionsticky
parameters.description: If true, any provided defaultversionsticky value is ignored. (See spec: Default Version of a Resource)

parameters.name: noreadonly
parameters.description: If true, attempts to update readonly attributes are silently ignored. (See spec: Resource Attributes)

parameters.name: setdefaultversionid
parameters.description: Specifies the versionid to be set as the default version. (See spec: Default Version of a Resource)

get.description: Gets the resource (default version). Supports $details view via the 'doc' query parameter. (See spec: Retrieving a Resource and Retrieving a Resource as Metadata)

200.description: The resource (or a redirect if a RESOURCEurl is set).

Content-Location.description: Permalink location of the returned version.

put.description: Creates or updates a resource. Accepts either the raw document (when $details is not used) or a full xRegistry metadata serialization (when $details is used). (See spec: Creating or Updating Resources and Versions, Resource Metadata vs Resource Document)

parameters.name: epoch
parameters.description: The current epoch value for concurrency control. (See spec: Mismatched Epoch)

requestBody.description: The resource document or xRegistry metadata (depending on URL suffix $details).

post.description: Creates a new version of the resource. If the resource does not exist, it is created at version 1; if it exists, the new version is created (default version may be updated using setdefaultversionid). (See spec: Creating or Updating Resources and Versions, Default Version of a Resource)

parameters.name: setdefaultversionid
parameters.description: Specifies the versionid to be set as the default version. (See spec: Default Version of a Resource)

requestBody.description: The new resource version document or xRegistry metadata.

delete.description: Deletes the resource and all of its versions. Requires the current epoch. (See spec: Deleting Resources)

parameters.name: epoch
parameters.description: The current epoch of the resource.

get.description: Gets an optionally filtered collection of versions for a resource. Supports pagination ('skip', 'top') and filtering. (See spec: Retrieving all Versions)

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of versions to skip.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: The maximum number of versions to return.

post.description: Creates or updates one or more versions of a resource. Query parameter 'setdefaultversionid' may be used to designate the new default version. (See spec: Creating or Updating Versions)

parameters.name: setdefaultversionid
parameters.description: Specifies the versionid for the default version. Use 'null' to reset to newest-default. (See spec: Default Version of a Resource)

requestBody.description: A map of version definitions keyed by versionid.

parameters.name: meta
parameters.description: If true, operate on version metadata view ($details).

get.description: Gets a specific version of a resource. Returns either the document (if not $details) or the metadata view. (See spec: Retrieving a Version and Retrieving a Version as Metadata)

delete.description: Deletes a specific version of a resource. Requires the current epoch. (See spec: Deleting a Version)

parameters.name: epoch
parameters.description: The current epoch of the version.

groupid.name: groupid
groupid.description: The unique identifier of the group.

resourceid.name: resourceid
resourceid.description: The unique identifier of the resource.

versionid.name: versionid
versionid.description: The unique identifier of the resource version.

resource-description.name: resource-description
resource-description.description: The description attribute for a resource.

resource-documentation.name: resource-documentation
resource-documentation.description: The documentation URL for a resource.

resource-labels.name: resource-labels
resource-labels.description: The labels attribute for a resource.

specversion.name: specversion
specversion.description: The xRegistry spec version to use.

inline.name: inline
inline.description: Commaâ€‘separated list of nested paths to inline (e.g. endpoints, endpoints.messages). See spec: Inline.

doc.name: doc
doc.description: If true, returns the document view (with relative URLs and default version data removed). See spec: Doc.

resource-id.description: The resource identifier. MUST be percentâ€‘encoded per xRegistry specifications (i.e. all nonâ€‘printable ASCII characters, spaces, quotes, and percent signs must be encoded).

resource-version.description: The resource version identifier. MUST be percentâ€‘encoded per xRegistry specifications.

resource-name.description: The resource name. MUST be percentâ€‘encoded per xRegistry specifications.

resource-self.description: The self URL of the resource. MUST be percentâ€‘encoded per xRegistry specifications.

resource-description.description: The resource description. MUST be percentâ€‘encoded per xRegistry specifications.

resource-documentation.description: The resource documentation URL. MUST be percentâ€‘encoded per xRegistry specifications.

resource-labels.description: Serialized resource labels. MUST be percentâ€‘encoded per xRegistry specifications.

resource-createdat.description: The resource creation timestamp. MUST be percentâ€‘encoded per xRegistry specifications.

resource-modifiedat.description: The resource modification timestamp. MUST be percentâ€‘encoded per xRegistry specifications.

Unauthorized.description: Unauthorized - API key missing or invalid, or authorization failed.

type.description: A URI reference that identifies the problem type.

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.

title.description: A short, humanâ€‘readable summary of the problem type.

detail.description: A humanâ€‘readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

enforcecompatibility.description: Indicates whether the server will enforce the compatibility rules.

items.description: A flag value. Values are case insensitive and may include extension values.

mutable.description: List of Registry items that can be edited by the client.

pagination.description: Indicates whether the server supports pagination.

items.description: A schema document format name, e.g. 'jsonSchema/2020-12' or 'xRegistry-json/1.0-RC1'.

schemas.description: List of schema formats supported by the server.

shortself.description: Indicates whether the 'shortself' attribute must be included in the server serialization.

specversions.description: List of xRegistry specification versions supported by the server.

sticky.description: Indicates whether the server supports clients choosing which version is the default.

specversion.description: The version of the xRegistry specification that this document adheres to.

registryid.description: An immutable unique identifier of the Registry.

self.description: The unique URL referencing the Registry entity.

shortself.description: A shorter alternative URL for the Registry entity.

xid.description: The unique xid (relative URL) of the Registry.

epoch.description: A numeric value representing the entity update version.

name.description: A human readable name for the Registry.

description.description: A human readable summary of the Registry.

documentation.description: A URL to additional documentation for the Registry.

labels.description: A map of label key/value pairs.

createdat.description: Timestamp for when the Registry was created.

modifiedat.description: Timestamp for when the Registry was last modified.

messagegroupsurl.description: The URL for retrieving the messagegroups (e.g. endpointsurl).

messagegroupscount.description: The count of messagegroups in the registry.

messagegroups.description: A map of messagegroups in the registry, keyed by messagegroup identifier. Present only if inlined.

RESOURCEid.description: The resource identifier for the meta sub-object; usually the same as the resource id.

self.description: The absolute URL of the meta sub-object.

shortself.description: A shorter alternative URL for the meta sub-object.

xid.description: The relative URL (xid) for the meta sub-object.

xref.description: A pointer to a linked resource, if applicable.

epoch.description: The epoch value for the meta sub-object.

createdat.description: The creation timestamp for the meta sub-object.

modifiedat.description: The last modification timestamp for the meta sub-object.

readonly.description: Indicates whether the resource is readonly.

compatibility.description: The compatibility level of the resource.

defaultversionid.description: The version id of the default version of the resource.

defaultversionurl.description: The URL of the default version of the resource.

defaultversionsticky.description: Indicates whether the default version is sticky.

envelope.description: Message envelope format identifier. This attribute MUST be the same as the 'envelope' attribute of the definition group, but is not automatically inherited because definitions may be cross-referenced across groups

Message envelope format identifier. This attribute MUST be the same as the 'envelope' attribute of the definition group, but is not automatically inherited because definitions may be cross-referenced across groups

time.description: The timestamp of when the event happened

dataschema.description: The uri of the schema that the event payload adheres to. If the dataschema attribute is not present, it MUST be interpreted as no schema. An application MAY assign a meaning to the dataschema attribute if it is not present by default

mode.description: Whether CloudEvents 'binary' or 'structure' mode will be used

format.description: The media type format used to serialize the CloudEvent in the case of mode=structured

protocol.description: Protocol identifier. This attribute MUST be the same as the 'protocol' attribute of the definition group, but is not automatically inherited because definitions may be cross-referenced across groups
Protocol identifier. This attribute MUST be the same as the 'protocol' attribute of the definition group, but is not automatically inherited because definitions may be cross-referenced across groups

required.description: Whether the message annotation is required

protocol.description: Protocol identifier. This attribute MUST be the same as the 'protocol' attribute of the definition group, but is not automatically inherited because definitions may be cross-referenced across groups
Protocol identifier. This attribute MUST be the same as the 'protocol' attribute of the definition group, but is not automatically inherited because definitions may be cross-referenced across groups
Protocol identifier. This attribute MUST be the same as the 'protocol' attribute of the definition group, but is not automatically inherited because definitions may be cross-referenced across groups

protocoloptions.description: The Apache Kafka message metadata constraints

protocol.description: Protocol identifier. This attribute MUST be the same as the 'protocol' attribute of the definition group, but is not automatically inherited because definitions may be cross-referenced across groups

path.description: The HTTP path as a uri template

epoch.description: Epoch time of the object creation

documentation.description: URI of the documentation of the object

basemessageurl.description: Reference to a base definition for this definition, either via a (relative) URL or a fragment identifier. The base definition is overridden by this definition. If not present, this definition does not override any base definition

dataschemaformat.description: The schema format applicable to the message payload, equivalent to the 'format' attribute of the schema registry

dataschema.description: The inline schema for the message payload, equivalent to the 'schema' attribute of the schema registry

dataschemauri.description: The URI of the schema for the message payload, equivalent to the 'schemaurl' attribute of the schema registry

datacontenttype.description: The content type for the message payload

epoch.description: Epoch time of the object creation

documentation.description: URI of the documentation of the object

envelope.description: Envelope format identifier that defines the common metadata information for the message. All definitions in this group share this envelope format. Mixed-envelope-format groups are not permitted

protocol.description: Protocol identifier that defines the transport message protocol. All definitions in this group share this protocol type. Mixed-protocol groups are not permitted
